message_1: Suppose that P, Q and R are propositions where P is true, Q is false, and R is true. What is the truth value of the proposition "[(P OR Q) AND R]"?
message_2:
To find the truth value of "[(P OR Q) AND R]", we will evaluate the truth values of the individual propositions and then apply the logical operators.

We are given that P is true, Q is false, and R is true.

Now, let's evaluate (P OR Q):
Since P is true and Q is false, (P OR Q) is true because in an OR operation, if at least one of the propositions is true, the result is true.

Now, we have [(P OR Q) AND R] which is equivalent to [(True) AND R].

Since R is true, we have [(True) AND (True)].

In an AND operation, if both propositions are true, the result is true. Therefore, the truth value of "[(P OR Q) AND R]" is True.
